Title: Generative Chatbot Adaptation for Odia Language: A Critical Evaluation
Abstract: large language models  large language model  have gained significant attention in the field of natural language processing  nlp  and artificial intelligence  artificial intelliegence  due to their ability to generate human like text and facilitate conversational interactions. however the majority of large language model are majorly developed for english limiting their accessibility and effectiveness for non english speaking populations. in india where only 10% of the population is proficient in english the need for large language model models adapted to regional languages becomes crucial. this research paper focuses on the adaptability of large language model to the odia language spoken by approximately 50 million people in india. with a primary objective to cater to the odia speaking community we aim to evaluate existing large language model models such as chatgpt and olive an instruction following odia large language model specifically in the context of generating conversational outputs in odia. we employ a critical evaluation approach to assess the performance language understanding and response generation capabilities of the large language model models for the odia language. by conducting experiments and comparative analysis we seek to determine the strengths weaknesses and potential areas of improvement for the existing large language model models. our findings will contribute to the development of more effective and contextually accurate generative chatbots for the odia language enabling better communication and accessibility for the odia speaking population.
